subject: Investing
title: Exchange Security Best Practices
description: A short lesson to help you apply Exchange Security Best Practices.

hook.text: Mt. Gox, once handling 70% of Bitcoin trades, was hacked for 850,000 BTC. Users waited a decade for partial refunds.

buildup.text: If you use a centralized exchange, its security practices directly affect the safety of your funds.

discovery.text: Enable two-factor authentication, use a dedicated email, and set withdrawal address whitelisting.

twist.text: Even with all precautions, exchange-held funds can be frozen by regulators or lost to insolvency.

climax.text: Only keep on exchanges what you're actively trading. Withdraw long-term holdings to self-custody.

punchline.text: An exchange is a tool, not a vault. Use it and move on.

quiz.question: What is the safest practice for long-term crypto holdings?
options: Keep them on the largest exchange
